title: (x "Floris") Jungle World: German weekly newspaper
content:
I saw this newspaper while in Berlin a while ago and thought the layout was very appealing and unconventional. It’s distributed on a weekly basis, and the content is mainly politics (from a left wing perspective as far as I could understand). There’s one typeface that is used throughout the newspaper, both in display and text, and at first glance I thought it was [Dolly](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907160715/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php?id1=dolly&id2=roman). But it’s less fluffy and has more serif in it.

Thanks,  
Malte

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907160715im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/14-2008-titel1_5123.gif)

 [‹ Print Magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907160715/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43928 "Go to previous forum topic") [CHICO'S logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907160715/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43930 "Go to next forum topic")
author: maltelunden

comments.content:
Hmm, methinks they’re rather influenced by _The Guardian_. And they’re not the first:

[http://www.newsdesigner.com/archives/002579.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907160715/http:/www.newsdesigner.com/archives/002579.php "http://www.newsdesigner.com/archives/002579.php")

Hi Malte,  
your Dolly suspicion wasn’t completely off: It’s ‘Dutch style’, at least! ;-)  
Jungle World used Floris, a custom font family by [Luc(as) de Groot](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907160715/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Luc%252528as%252529%252Bde%252BGroot). Read more about it [in this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907160715/http:/www.typophile.com/expert_level#comment-257418) (a recent Type ID Quiz). By the way, the brush script nameplate has been designed by de Groot, too.  
F

Amazing Florian. Thank you!

It was entertaining to read the ID-quiz on the exact same typeface. If only I had dared peeked inside I would have been able to give a hint at least. This typeface has been distracting my mind for quite some time now.. From what I understood of your comments in the quiz-thread, this font can’t be licensed? Too bad.

– _Malte_
I don’t know for sure. Just ask the foundry, [Lucasfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907160715/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/).
